resources.string: For questions, send an email to:\nsmsalarm@outlook.com
This application is developed and distributed in the hope that it will be of use, but without any warranty that it will function as intended in all situations.
Line busy, will call back in:
Enter a message that Sms Alarm acknowledges with.
Enter a phone number that Sms Alarm acknowledges to.
The device is in flight mode.
Enter a word which Sms Alarm will trigger primary alarm on, if present in the received SMS.
Enter a phone number which Sms Alarm will trigger primary alarm on.
Enter a regular expression which Sms Alarm will trigger primary alarm on if a match of the expression is found in the received SMS.
Enter a word which Sms Alarm will trigger secondary alarm on, if present in the received SMS.
Enter a phone number which Sms Alarm will trigger secondary alarm on.
Enter a regular expression which Sms Alarm will trigger secondary alarm on if a match of the expression is found in the received SMS.
Edit word which Sms Alarm will trigger primary alarm on if it is found in the received SMS.
Edit phone number which Sms Alarm will trigger primary alarm on.
Edit regular expression which Sms Alarm will trigger primary alarm on if a match of the expression is found in the received SMS.
Edit word which Sms Alarm will trigger secondary alarm on if it is found in the received SMS.
Edit phone number which Sms Alarm will trigger secondary alarm on.
Edit regular expression which Sms Alarm will trigger secondary alarm on if a match of the expression is found in the received SMS.
An error occurred retrieving alarm from the database. See the error log for more information.

Sms Alarm is not a substitute for pagers or other systems designed for alerting rescue personnel. The developer of Sms Alarm is not responsible for and can not be held responsible for any damages to life, property or the environment arising from the use of Sms Alarm. The developer of the Sms Alarm will also not be responsible for any damage incurred to the device in connection with the use of Sms Alarm.
Flash notification is not supported because of an incompatible Android version, Gingerbread or versions later are required.
Flash notification is not supported because the device is missing a rear camera.
Flash notification is not supported because the device has no camera.
Flash notification is not supported because the device has no flash.
Set if acknowledgment of alarms should be used and in that case how it should be done, phone number that the acknowledgment is done to and message for acknowledgment.
Do you feel that Sms Alarm makes a difference in your life and want to show your support for the application? Review Sms Alarm at Google Play™ and if you feel you for it, write something about it.
If selected primary alarm can be acknowledged.
If selected, Sms Alarm will trigger alarms according to given information, else the application does not.

If selected, all incoming SMS\'s will be logged to the file smslog.txt in the folder SmsAlarm. The information that will be logged is time received, sender and message. Note that this feature is used mainly for debugging purposes, otherwise it should be disabled.
Set the words that Sms Alarm will trigger an alarm on if it\'s found in the incoming SMS. Note that this function is not case sensitive.

Set your organisation\'s name, if the device\'s camera flash should flash upon incoming alarms, if the splash screen should be shown and if Sms Alarm should be enabled. It is also possible to enable SMS logging which can facilitate troubleshooting.
If selected, the alarm signal for both primary and secondary alarms will be played repeatedly until the notification of the incoming alarm is handled.
If selected Sms Alarm will play alarm signal to both primary and secondary alarms twice.
Set the regular expressions that Sms Alarm will trigger an alarm on if a match of the expression is found in the incoming SMS.
Note. These settings are addressed to the more advanced user. Learn more about regular expressions at Wikipedia:\nwikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_expression
If selected the splash screen will be shown.
Set the telephone numbers that Sms Alarm will trigger an alarm on if the receiver of incoming SMS is the same as any set telephone number.

Set the alarm signals and vibration patterns for both primary and secondary alarms. It is also possible to set if Sms Alarm should follow the device\'s sound settings and if the alarm signal should be played twice or repeatedly.

If selected, the device\'s camera flash will flash upon incoming alarm. Note that this is currently a BETA feature wherein unexpected behaviour can occur when an alarm is received. Use it at your own risk.
If selected, Sms Alarm will take the device\'s ring volume and silent mode into consideration.
No alarm has yet been received.
Do you want to remove the following word from the list of primary alarms: %s?
Do you want to remove the following phone number from the list of primary alarms: %s?
Do you want to remove the following regular expression from the list of primary alarms: %s?
Do you want to remove the following word from the list of secondary alarms: %s?
Do you want to remove the following phone number from the list of secondary alarms: %s?
Do you want to remove the following regular expression from the list of secondary alarms: %s?
The application DOES NOT DETECT the device sound settings.
The application DETECTS the device sound settings.
No alarm has yet been received
has been removed from the list of alarm signals as they could not be found on the device.
Cannot acknowledge! No phone number to acknowledge to exists. Check the settings and the sender of the received SMS.
Word for primary and secondary alarm cannot be same. Enter a new word.
Telephone number for primary and secondary alarms may not be the same. Enter a new telephone number.
Regular expressions for primary and secondary alarms may cannot be the same. Enter a new expression.
The specified word already exists in the list of words for primary alarm. Enter a new word.
The specified word already exists in the list of words for secondary alarm. Enter a new word.
The selected audio file is already in the list of alarm signals.
The specified phone number is already in the list of primary alarms. Enter a new phone number.
The specified phone number is already in the list of secondary alarms. Enter a new phone number.
A phone number must be specified.
Specified regular expression is already in the list of expressions for primary alarms. Enter a new expression.
Specified regular expression is already in the list of expressions for secondary alarms. Enter a new expression.
A regular expression must be specified.
You must start Sms Alarm and agree to the user agreement before you may use this widget.
